Class SeatingAlg

  • java.lang.Object
    • SeatingAlg
  • public class SeatingAlg
extends java.lang.Object
    The SeatingAlg class provides methods and tools for generating seating arrangements given an ArrayList of Students
    Since:
    2019-02-14

    • Method Detail

      • generateTables

        public java.util.ArrayList<Table> generateTables​(java.util.ArrayList<Student> students,
                                                 int tableSize)
        This method is the driving function for table generation. Any settings (ie. maxRuntime()) must be set before this method is called.
        Parameters:
        students - ArrayList of Students to be seated.
        tableSize - Integer number of students that can bes seating per table.
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of Table objects.

      • outputStatistics

        public void outputStatistics()
        This method will print some statistics into the console. Must be called after generateTables(), and uses the result of the last generation.
        Full details on output:
        Percentage of friendships satisfied: Number of friendships seated together / total number of friendships
        Mean percent satisfaction per person: Average friendsAtTable / total friends per person. People with no friends are assumed to be fully happy, as they were satisfied to the full ability of this software.
        Adjusted mean percent satisfaction per person: Uses the adjusted scores that are actually used to pick the optimal seating arrangement. The calculation is (-0.75 / (2 * friends at table + 1) + 0.75) + (-1/4.0) * (friendsAtTable / (totalFriends * 1.0) - 1)^2 + 0.25
        Median percent satisfaction per person: Median percent satisfactions (friends at table / total friends)
        Adjusted median percent satisfaction per person: Adjusted median percent satisfaction (uses same calculations described in adjusted mean percent satisfaction)

      • showUISettings

        public void showUISettings​(boolean setting)
        This method is a builder that sets preferences for your algorithm. If True, then a UI will appear when `generateTables()` is called.
        Default is true
        Parameters:
        setting - should be true if you want user to select settings with UI. Should be false to always use defaults / set settings in TicketingSystem.

      • bidirectionalFriendships

        public void bidirectionalFriendships​(boolean setting)
        This method is a builder that sets preferences for your algorithm. If True, then friendships will be assumed to go both ways (if Person A is Person B's friend, then Person B is also Person A's friend)
        Parameters:
        setting - should be true if you want bidirectional friendships, otherwise false. Default is true.

      • communist

        public void communist​(boolean setting)
        This method is a builder that sets preferences for the algorithm.
        If True, then the algorithm will optimize for lower standard deviation rather than greater happiness. This algorithm will attempt to pick higher scores if the standard deviation is within 5%.
        Parameters:
        setting - should be true if you want to implement communism, otherwise false. Default is false.

      • special

        public void special​(boolean setting)
        This method is a builder that sets preferences for the algorithm.
        If True, then the algorithm will use it's custom equation for calculating participant satisfaction.
        Parameters:
        setting - should be true if you want to use the custom equation, otherwise false. Default is true.

      • maxRuntime

        public void maxRuntime​(int setting)
        This method is a builder that sets preferences for the algorithm.
        Input should be the approximate number of seconds the algorithm will run. Default is 5.
        Parameters:
        setting - approximate number of seconds to run algorithm.
